title: Scott Willsey
description: Long time Twitter and all around pal. Good guy with an affinity for tech and the open web.

title: Amit Gawande
description: A microblogger I followed at micro.blog and whose thoughts I am interested in and enjoy reading about.

title: Brent Simmons
description: Maker of my favorite RSS reader for Apple devices and a former developer of my favorite all time RSS reader of any platform, FeedDemon for Windows.

title: Joel Spolsky
description: The man, the myth, the legend.

title: Joe Ross
description: Excellent follow on Mastodon and his writing is some of the more interesting in the indie tech space.

title: Jason Burke
description: Another micro.blog follow. His blog is also just a fantastic place; the landing page is just super fun.

title: Sarah Drasner
description: Sarah really needs no introduction. She's an expert on SVG, core team member of Vue, award winning speaker and staff writer on CSS-Tricks.

title: Road to Homelab
description: An interesting blog to follow if you're just starting a homelab.

title: Tech Addressed
description: Advanced Linux tutorials for adventurous homelabbers.

title: Techno Tim
description: The man that made it easy for me to go down the homelab rabbit hole with his easy explanations and infectious charisma.

title: It's FOSS
description: Easy going Linux and FOSS articles for the new Linux user.

title: Aaron Godfrey
description: An excellent resource for home automation outside of homelab setups.

title: Tanner's Tech
description: Tanner was the only person who could guide me through setting up Grafana to monitor Proxmox. Give him a read if homelabs are your thing.
